net.sf.appia.core
Class ChannelCursor

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.ChannelCursor

public class ChannelCursor
extends java.lang.Object

A ChannelCursor is the way of accessing the Channel Sessions stack.
With the ChannelCursor we can access any position in the stack, and if desired we can set the Session for that position.
It is mainly used to create a stack with specific Sessions, in particular to allow a Session to belong to more than one Channel.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Alexandre Pinto
See Also:
AppiaCursorException

down

public void down()
          throws AppiaCursorException
Go to the Session imediatly below in the Channel stack.

Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with two possible types: CURSORNOTSET, CURSORONBOTTOM

Go to the Session imediatly above in the Channel stack.

Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with two possible types: CURSORNOTSET, CURSORONTOP

isPositioned

public boolean isPositioned()
Is the cursor in a valid position, is it set ?

Returns:
true if the cursor is within the satck, false otherwise

setSession

public void setSession(Session session)
                throws AppiaCursorException
Set the Session for the current position in the Channel stack.

Parameters:
session - the Session to set
Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with three possible types: CURSORNOTSET, ALREADYSET, WRONGLAYER,

getSession

public Session getSession()
                   throws AppiaCursorException
Get the current Session in the Channel stack.

Returns:
the current Session, null if no Session has been set for the current position
Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with three possible types: CURSORNOTSET, CURSORONBOTTOM, CURSORONTOP

getLayer

public Layer getLayer()
               throws AppiaCursorException
Get the Layer of the QoS stack, that corresponds to the current position in the Channel stack.

Returns:
layer the Layer corresponding to the current position
Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with one possible type: CURSORNOTSET

jump

public void jump(int offset)
          throws AppiaCursorException
Jumps a number of Layers. If the offset is positive then it will jump upwards. Otherwise it will jump downwards.

Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with two possible type: CURSORNOTSET, INVALIDPOSITION

            throws AppiaCursorException

Throws:
AppiaCursorException - with two possible type: CURSORNOTSET, INVALIDPOSITION
